summary: This document appears to be an FBI interview summary (302 form) with a massage therapist who worked at Jeffrey Epstein's New Mexico ranch. The witness describes the layout of the property, her interactions with Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, the nature of her massages, financial arrangements, and observations of other individuals at the ranch, including young women and a physicist. The document details the professional relationship turning sexual with Epstein and includes Maxwell's instructions regarding recruiting additional women.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation; owner of the New Mexico ranch where the witness provided massages. The witness states the massages with him turned sexual.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as the 'lady of the house' and Epstein's girlfriend at the ranch. She managed logistics, gave the witness a non-disclosure agreement, and made comments about recruiting young, attractive women.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Present during the witness's interview, presumably representing or advising the witness.

persons.name: AUSA Detective
persons.context: Present during the interview, conducting the official inquiry.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Present during the interview, conducting the official inquiry.

connections.description: Witness thought Maxwell was Epstein's girlfriend and describes her as the 'lady of the house' who managed the ranch and spoke on his behalf.
Maxwell acted as the house manager for Epstein's ranch, coordinating schedules and giving instructions to staff like the witness.
Epstein paid the witness for massages via checks from his corporation. The professional relationship turned sexual.
Maxwell was the primary contact who called the witness to the ranch, gave her a non-disclosure agreement, and gave her instructions about the types of women to recruit.

events.title: Witness Reads Vanity Fair Article About Epstein
events.description: The witness recalls reading a Vanity Fair article about Jeffrey Epstein in 2003, which caused her to recognize the significance of her former client.

events.title: Witness Observes Sarah Kellen at Ranch
events.description: The witness recalls seeing Sarah Kellen (referred to by initials in the document) at the ranch more than once around 2001/2002.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's ranch in New Mexico (referred to as 'the ranch')
The main mansion with the number '2' on it
Massage room, gym, and pool area in the basement
keyFacts: A massage therapist provided services at Jeffrey Epstein's New Mexico ranch for approximately three years, with Epstein visiting 3-4 times per year.
The witness states her massages with Jeffrey Epstein turned sexual. She was paid $100 to drive to the ranch and $100 for the massage via checks from Epstein's corporation.
Ghislaine Maxwell acted as the house manager, gave the witness a non-disclosure agreement (which she did not sign), and instructed her to recruit young, pretty, attractive women with no body hair.
The witness describes the ranch layout in detail, including a basement area with no windows containing a massage room, gym, and pool, and noted pictures of topless women in a bathroom.
The witness recalls seeing Sarah Kellen (identified by initials) at the ranch multiple times around 2001/2002 and massaged other guests including a girl with a British accent and a physicist.
